definition: to decline/to wane/to become weak or feeble

sentences.english: He had a disease called Progeria.
sentences.chinese: 他得了一种叫作儿童早衰症的病。

sentences.english: The findings suggest that regularly sleeping for seven hours during the night can help to reduce the cognitive decline that occurs as we grow older.
sentences.chinese: 这项发现表明每晚睡7小时，能减少大脑早衰。

sentences.english: Burn-in is a manufacturing operation that is intended to eliminate early failure.
sentences.chinese: 预烧是为了减少产品早衰的生产过程必要的手段。

sentences.english: Grapes could protect against skin cancer and prevent premature ageing, research has revealed.
sentences.chinese: 研究发现，葡萄可以防止皮肤癌以及防止早衰。

sentences.english: Braverman points out that not all premature aging signs are written on your face.
sentences.chinese: 布雷弗曼指出，并非所有的早衰迹象都会表现在脸上。

sentences.english: We may prevent the early aging, may also benefit hepatorenal and can prevent the kidney empty lumbago.
sentences.chinese: 本方可防止早衰，又可以补益肝肾和能预防肾虚腰痛。

sentences.english: Unlike menopause, it is possible for POF to be temporary.
sentences.chinese: 不同于更年期，卵巢早衰很可能是一个暂时期。

sentences.english: After her cancer treatment, the patient had premature ovarian failure. Meth…
sentences.chinese: 癌症治疗结束后，患者出现了卵巢早衰的表现。

sentences.english: The oldest sufferer of a similar condition lived to the age of 26.
sentences.chinese: 世界上患早衰症的人最老的活了26岁。

sentences.english: This will not only prevent senescence but will also contribute to better fruit quality.
sentences.chinese: 这不仅为了防止早衰，并有助于提高果品质量。

sentences.english: Hypothesis in 40 years before the menopause, is premature ovarian failure.
sentences.chinese: 假设在40岁之前就停经的话，就是卵巢早衰了。

definition: to age/to deteriorate with age/old and weak
baldness/to lose hair or feathers/to molt/depilation
impotence/also written 陽痿|阳痿[yang2 wei3]
imbalance/to become dysfunctional/to lack proper care (after an illness etc)
